author: TJ n Ohio
title: Quality, Durability & Usefulness
content: We looked at several different styles of protectors prior to choosing the origami style. We were hesitant at first because it looked bulky and too rigid to be convenient to use. However, after using it for several months I can confidently report it was the best option for me. I often use my Kindle for "hands off" reading like recipes and repair manuals. The origami stand is a perfect accessory for either portrait or landscape documents; and it is sturdy enough that when I need to navigate it doesn't fall over when I touch the controls on the screen (Big Plus). The durability is second to none. I put my kindle in the outside pocket of a thin carry-on bag. Forgetting it was there I checked the bag at the airport. I watched them treat the bag as expected while it loaded the plane, came off the plane and then was pounded to death by other luggage on the baggage claim carousel, but you could tell I wasn't worried because I had a slight grin on my face showing I was confident that the origami would protect my Kindle - which I am currently using to type this review.  I highly recommend this product with confidence and satisfaction!

author: Michael's_Amazon
title: I like this case but.......
content:
I purchased this case at the same time I purchased the Fire HD.  I agree with majority of the positive reviews, it is a good looking case, I like like the color and texture.

However I also found the same problem a lot of other reviewers have experienced, the random powering on and off, the magnetic case cover not shutting the unit down when closed, or turning it on when opening.

Me being me, I looked the case over and decided to "repair" the cause of the problem myself.  I know this voided the warranty and I will not be able to return this case, but I like the case enough to accept that outcome.

The root issue is that the power "button" in the case protrudes slightly too much inside the case, making intermittent contact with the power button on the Kindle itself, causing all of the aforementioned complaints.  So I relieved the case of this problematic plastic button (more like a rivet, it is two pieces) and am very much pleased with the result.

Opening and closing the cover actually does exactly what it was designed to do now every single time, no exceptions.  So far I have not needed to press the power button, if I ever do I'll just use a pen/pencil tip, or take it out of the case.

title: Nice cover, but overpriced
content:

And the "origami" nature of it makes it handy to stand the unit up. It automatically powers up the unit when you open it, which is a nice feature.

On the negative side, to call it "leather" is a bit of a stretch. There's some leather and a lot of vinyl/plastic. And a cover simply shouldn't cost more than $30 in my mind, unless it's loaded with gold leaf. It's also slightly "homely" from an aesthetic perspective. So I give it 4 stars instead of 5 for being overpriced (note that the price has come way down since I made this review - at $18 it's an excellent deal all the way round).

content: Since the Kindle is not an inexpensive item, I thought it better to spend a few more buck and buy a case for each Kindle (2).  It's not the most exciting thing in the world, but it works great.  Utilitarian items don't get 5 stars, but it should

author: Boy from Brooklyn
title: The e-mail is good, all apps work fine
content: The e-mail is good, all apps work fine. One complaint is that it has an on/off button that is too sensitive. In the middle of reading, Kindle will ask if I want to shut down when I haven't pressed the button but might've merely glanced it while I was holding the Kindle.

author: MARY E. OBRIEN
title: Good idea
content: The case is very useful, first to protect and then to use when I am on a plane or reading in bed.  It is a very useful design.

author: O. K. Bryant
title: The best
content: This case will do almost everything. It will make the Kindle stand in both directions and go to sleep with just a flip of the cover.  Make sure you get one with your Kindle.

author: Don
title: Nice looking case
content: Nice looking case, seems pretty touch. The only thing I wonder about is the magnetic cover and how it will affect the screen of my kindle over time.

author: LaSenorita
title: Origami case
content: Love this origami case. I like the flexibility of the case but sometimes a challenge to hold.

author: Kindle lover
title: Great case
content: Greatest case ever made. I love it, gives my old kindle fire a new look.

author: Machell Martin
title: Love My Kindle! ☺️
content:
Needles to say, I love my Kindle Fire HD! My husband loves his Kindle Fire as well!

We're like two little kids at Christmas!  Haha!

author: ELIXABETH L.. BATZER
title: Does not fit older Kindle FireHD 7"
content: This case does not fit the older Kindle Fire HD 7".  I ordered this twice thinking that I made a mistake in ordering due to the case is slightly larger than what is needed.  We went to Best Buy to check on sizing.  We found out the newer version of the Kindle Fire HD 7" is taller and narrower than the old version.  It is sad because there does not seem to be a desired case for this kindle that I own.

author: Sally Edith
title: It works and it is fun and easy!!
content: It was a little hard at first to fold the stand, but once I got it down after a few tries it was easy and functional.  I like the red color it goes with my bag and all.

author: T. Burkett
title: Good protection but...
content: The case has a sturdy feel but it's design is not correct the way the power button aligns it keeps shuting down the computer. Also the way it uses magnets attaches paper clips and other metal things. I am worried about putting it in my bag with my portable hard drives.

author: Kathleen Schwartz
title: very disappointed in this product
content: This case did not cut the kindle snug. I had to remove it from the case to turn on and off. And to adjust the volume. I tried three different cases and finally have up and bought another brand. Very disappointed.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Almost what I wanted
content: It did fit my Kindle Fire HD 7, but I had to cut holes for the power cord and camera.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great stand
content: Loves how it folds into a stand.  Great protection when closed

author: Debra
title: Mine fits perfectly, so works well
content: I am very pleased with the case as it works exactly as it is supposed to and fits like a glove. Only thing I might add is a clasp so that other things in a purse aren't able to push there way in...  It seems from the mixed reviews that others have gotten cases that do not fit as intended, which makes me wonder whether there isn't a production issue of some kind.  I'm very glad I took the chance with it.

author: Barbara Elkins
title: Case turns power off
content: It doesn't work with my Kindle Fire. The power button kept turning off because of the case. Very disappointing.  I bought another case so am out the money for this case.

author: ron_desktop
title: Leather Origami Case for Kindle Fire HD
content: I use the case to hold my Kindle in an upright position on my seat tray.  No weight on my hands, fingers or arms and I can read the text with ease.  Would not want any other case.  It is a little expensive, but well worth the cost for extended use.

author: justmyopinion
title: doesn't work as described
content: Description said it when case is closed, the kindle auto shuts off...that doesn't happen...also have to remove from case to turn it on...and yes, it's on correctly. It's also rather heavy for what it is.

author: DK
title: Useful Kindle stand
content: Red color looks great. Great for viewing in landscape mode, however in portrait mode tablet needs additional support or it falls over.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love it
content: Works great - the inside of the case is like velvet to protect the screen. I had bought a cover in the store, it was a basic black and didn't have the ability to stand like this was does, so glad I took it back and found this cover on the internet.

author: JJ
title: A must have!!
content: This works great with my Kindle Fire HD.  It is a very dark red; which is different than what is shown in the picture, but it is still red and is a great stand and protector.  I definitely recommend getting one of these!!!

author: rev.ian.m
title: Don't bother, it shuts itself off.
content:
I ordered my first one because it kept shutting off my Kindle. I figured it was a manufacturing error. They replaced it, no problem. But now the second one does the same thing. I sent it back for a refund. It's overpriced for a thin piece of plastic 'leather,' and now that I have play with it, it is also poorly designed.
Luckily Amazon's superior customer service is willing to take it back, which leads me to believe this is a growing trend.

author: beachbunny
title: Did not fit
content: It is a really nice cover, sadly it did not fit my kindle (even though it said it would) so I had to return it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: This is sooo much better....
content: ...than the previous cover I had for my keyboard Kindle.  And for that one, I required an additional light source!  Since my new Kindle Fire does not need a light source, this cover is outstanding.  Works just like it is supposed to.  The blue color is moderately bright, as opposed to simply black...I am a trendy gal!

author: Doc Don
title: Works Great
content: I love being able to prop up kindle using this cover. Makes it easy to use in either position you choose.

author: Lela Musarra
title: Origami Standing Leather Case
content: Love it, it is the perfect accessory for my fabulous Kindle Fire HD. It allows me to use my Kindle in either a portrait or landscape view, and hands free. It protects the Kindle from any damage, and looks very professional. It's sturdy, but stylish.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it!
content: I bought the cover for my son's kindle that he received as a gift.  He loves the fact that the cover puts his kindle to sleep, that way all he has to do is close it and he's done.  He was also thrilled it came in his favorite color.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Two Stars
content: Was ok but didn't fit my Kindle  model as description stated.  Had to return

author: rycar
title: Five Stars
content: I wish I could get a case this good for my iPad.

author: Michael D. Morse
title: Fit like a glove!
content: The cover fit like a glove and it is attractive.  I am happy.

author: Cristine A. LIeb
title: Don't buy this tablet
content: This is not worth buying.  I began having problems with it turning itself off occasionally after a few months.  I finally called Amazon when it shut itself off as soon as it reached 50% power every time and they had me run a cleaner which erased all of my downloads and game progress.  I downloaded everything again .  It then started shutting itself off again.  Next they had me do a factory reset. I lost everything again Finally, they replaced it with the same model.  I had that one 2-3 months and it began shutting itself down for no reason. It also froze pretty frequently. They again replaced it with the same model. Since my original warranty will be up next month, I asked what I'm supposed to do when the new one started shutting itself down.  I was told by a snotty young man named Anthony that I had no way of knowing what would happen. I've had the new one about a week. The last two days, it has shut itself off when I am in the middle of something.  While I appreciate Amazon replacing my defective device, giving me another defective device is not helpful.  Amazon is my go to store for everything. I am very disappointed with this product and with Amazon's response.  It appears that they will just stall me with defective devices until my warranty is up and then expect I will buy another one.  That won't happen.

author: SpeedyE
title: Good Protective cover
content: I like this case, keeps my screen protected and when folded makes a great stand for viewing.  Would buy another one if I ever needed to.

author: Carey Sanders
title: It's just "okay", more of a nuisance.
content: It should be clearly marked to not place this case's magnetic surface on your laptop's keyboard! I thought my computer was ruined, What was really going on is that the magnet in this case was confusing my laptop into thinking I had closed the laptop, and the screen would go blank until I removed the kindle. It really is more of a nuisance than a help. It's hard to get to the volume control because of this case's design, and the case tends to fall apart and fold during reading/holding. I plan to replace it. I was going to give this case 2 stars, however, I gave it 3 stars because the standing feature is nice and works, which is what this case is, I guess, meant for. Holds firm, doesn't fall apart while standing, very sturdy when standing. I can tap away on the screen and it doesn't budge.

author: Ben C Saltz
title: great cover
content: I purchased the Red cover because I bought the purple on for my wife's Kindle. It's a great Cover for the Kindle.

author: Frankie Jones
title: Love it!!!
content: Took a little getting used to but now I love it....protects my Kindle and you can stand it all different ways!

author: Kindle Customer
title: I love this case!
content: This is the best case for Kindle Fire HD that I have seen.  I love it!  The color is not bright red but rather more a maroon color.  It fits perfectly and stands several ways.  You won't be sorry if you buy this one.

author: Michael Burke
title: very  clever
content: this is an unusual design and works quite well at standing up the screen, either portrait orf landscape. works with built in magnets and closes securely. somewhat heavy as is the kindle itself.

author: John Walling
title: Outstanding quality
content: Once I had completely seated my kindle fire in the case, it makes it less likely to be dropped. Fairly priced.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Four Stars
content: The cover was very good but I cared more for the MOCO cover with I had before.

author: Wilhelmina
title: Case for Kindle Fire
content: Love my new Kindle Fire, and love the Origami Case. Looks good, and does a good job of protecting and making reading more convenient.

author: Sara
title: Love it!
content: Got this for my husband to go with the Kindle I got him for Christmas. He loves it! Sleek but protective...

author: judy l
title: Five Stars
content: Works great!

author: Clara Vice
title: Not Impressed
content: This case is "ok" but the standard hard back case will work just as good.  This works okay on a hard table top but is not made for a laptop use.

author: S. Harrah
title: Kindle doesn't work while in case.
content:
After sending 2 of these back because the kindle fire wouldn't work while in the case, I have ordered a cheaper case. Hopefully it will work. I ordered the Amazon case because it was made especially for the new kindle fire hd. Silly me thought it would be the best one to buy.

I do appreciate how easy Amazon made it to send back though. I had no problems getting a refund either time.

author: Arthur D. MacPherson
title: An 'ON' button that doesn't turn on
content: This case fits the Kindle Fire nicely. Almost too snugly, because every time it powers off, i have to pop it out of the case to hit the start button. There is an indentation on the bottom of the case that aligns with the power button. It doesn't work, no matter how hard you push. So when the Kindle is sleeping, you have to pop it out of this case, push the start button and snap it back in. A small thing, maybe. But annoying, especially as this is an Amazon-branded product, not made by a third party.

author: Verona D
title: Very Good Product
content: I received a Kindle Fire as a gift, but no case.  I was unsure what case would fit it.  After emailing support services I was advised my kindle was 3rd generation.  I read all the reviews about the cases for my kindle and decided to purchase the leather origami case.  The price had dropped when I finally bought it.  It fits perfect.  I love the feature that turns it on when you open the case.  I have only used it once to watch a program and the stand works well.  No complaints and would recommend it.

author: Dee .n
title: origami case
content:
origami case was a present for my grandson.he love it it has lots of versatility.perfect for him! he had to play with it and find all the
positions he can use.

author: Tomera
title: what did they do?!
content: They shrunk the size!! This one does not fit my Kindele Fire!! I am in Mexico, so no return possible.

author: Susan
title: Love it
content: With my new Kindle Fire HD this cover really is nice for this particular Kindle, its flexible and has a nice leather feel much better than the plastic cover we were thinking of.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Better than no case
content: I liked the case on my old Kindle Fire HD much better. It will not fit this new Kindle HD. I do not like the location of the on/off switch on the new Kindle-it is hard to use with this case.

author: Alice M
title: so it won't go flat again very easily. I tend only to jam the kindle into ...
content: It was disappointing. Its hard to get the kindle into it, you cannot turn the kindle on or off while in the case, it turns off the kindle if you try to use the case with it after you turn the kindle on! Also, the thing tends to want to keep its shape after you use the stand up feature, so it won't go flat again very easily. I tend only to jam the kindle into it for traveling.

author: Bobby Mitchell
title: The Perfect Case!
content: To start with, the Leather Origami Case fits perfectly and allows access to the volume controls, power button, headphone jack, and screen. Most times, I simply open the cover, power on the Kindle and start reading, working, or playing. When I want to share videos, or watch Netflix with the kids, The angles in the case fold out very quickly to create a stable stand for a nice horizontal, widescreen viewing experience. The case also provides protection for my Kindle, which goes with me about everywhere. I've been working in the IT field for over 15 years and never thought that I would find much use for a tablet versus a laptop. I was wrong.

author: Stephen Handy
title: A very nice protective case!
content: I like the way the case allows the full screen to be viewed and I especially like the origami stand. Oh yes, the case holds your Kindle very securely and compactly. I have two misgivings about the case, however, 1. The Kindle is hard to remove from the case. 2. The sleep/power button on the case requires a lot of pressure to engage the Kindle's sleep/power button. I would certainly give the case five stars if it weren't for those two difficulties.Thank you.

author: michele simon
title: nice sturdy case but......
content: I just purchased my kindle and case together. I thought the kindle was defective because it kept turning off and on repeatedly. Then I took it out of the case and no more problems. We figured out that the case is so tight that it keeps hitting the power button and causing the problem. I ended up popping out the little button on the case and making the hole a little bigger so it doesn't rub the kindles power button. Works fine now,

author: ken mclain
title: great
content: Helpful and practicable.  Very easy to use as a stand and provides protection when not in use.  Recommend to others.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Boo! Not good
content: Big disappointment.  Supposed to fit my Kindle Fire, but it doesn't. The buttons don't line up at all, and there's space between the Kindle and the sides. I'll be returning this item.

author: Randy Sluss
title: My kindle is not an hd. So it didn't ...
content: My kindle is not an hd. So it didn't fit. I thought the hd was the same size as a regular kindle. I probably need to return it. I thought I had Amazon prime, but you charged me shipping.

author: Alice B. Economy
title: Kindle Fire Standing Leather Origami Case
content: Love the Kindle Fire Standing Origami Case.  It's very protective, and once placed in the case, you will never have to remove it to charge, or to turn it on.  Also, it stands easily making it easy to use.

author: Gazela Ann Bell
title: Love it. It protects my Kindle and gives me ...
content: Love it.  It protects my Kindle and gives me the stand that I need when using the Kindle.

author: Cinders
title: Disappointing
content: I have this product.  I.bought it a week ago.  It makes a nice kindle stand but a very poor case.  The new kindle fire is awsome and I do not like it when the case fails to protect and function as advertised.  I cannot work the on button or the volume button while in this case.  Also the kindle does not turn off when the case closes.  Finally the kindle does not fit securely inside this case. There is about a 1/4 inch room on the sides that allows the kindle to fall out.  I am so disappointed......

author: Dianne J Ferris
title: Love, love it!
content: I did a lot of research after I bought my Kindle reader. I liked the choices this Origami case gave, as to holding the Kindle horizontal or vertical, the colours and the choice of material as well. I purchased this colour pictured here, as it gave me enough colour to be pleasing and yet wasn't too bright either to take away from the screen. I chose leather and LOVE the whole appearance as well as the functionality of it. It all works, open the case, the kindle turns on, close it and it's off. Great design, I highly recommend this one...Great job, designers!

author: Tammy D. Shotts
title: Kindle Fire HD Case
content: Love this type of case for my Kindle Fire HD. This one is a red leather and was a great price through Amazon. Nice, sturdy case that doesn't add a lot of weight to my Kindle.

author: Evelyn K. Gerlach
title: Origami Case
content: Hey, what can I say - it makes my Kindle easier to read and I love it! Well, here are three more words....this is beyond belief I have to write three more words.  I like the product but I hate writing the review if I have to write so many words - is this 5th grade?

author: Kindle Customer
title: Origami Case
content: Love this case! Makes reading or watching movies so much easier when I don't have to keep hold of the Kindle.

author: QueensQ
title: Classy and durable.
content:
This case is so versatile.
And looks great.  Leather is good quality.
Protected my kindle after a few drops too.
Well worth it.
Glad I bought it.

author: beth breitfelder
title: Great
content: I really like the cover.  I can contour the back to stand  all most anywhere.  That comes in real handy.

author: luv2read
title: Though the cover feels more like textured plastic than leather
content:
It fits the Kindle HD perfectly, snug and secure. Though the cover feels more like textured plastic than leather. That's a disappointment. I buy leather because I like it's durability, and it's feel.

I have found that I need to be very careful not to accidently touch the power button! Sometimes I've been fortunate enough to get the screen shot that asks me if I want to power off my Kindle HD first. Odd that the sound buttons don't seem to be sensitive at all. Maybe it's just how I handle mine?

As for positioning the Amazon Kindle HD Standing Leather Origami Case; I've only used it one afternoon at my desk, in the horizontal position. That worked pretty well. Just where and how the Kindle HD sits is pre-determined due to the molded lines in the case. I did try to stand it up right (as a paperback). I could not find any spot or angel that would allow the Kindel HD to be stand upright. The case is to flimsy for this purpose.

The back is flimsy in general. It's not a case I would pick if I had another better option.

author: Alfred Pick
title: Nice case, but could use a couple of features, price too
content: It is a very nice case made for Amazon HD/HDX.  We have one of each and these cases for them.  They are very nice, slim, no latches (magnets), instant on/off, tricky but good stand.  Needs a pocket for a cleaning cloth and maybe a scrap of paper.  Also a place to store the stylus.  We use the hinge, but have to move it from inside to outside depending on whether it is open.  I am a bit concerned about the stress on the leather hinge.  Will advise.  Amazon, tweak the design on this and cut your profit to under 1000%.

author: DREAMANGEL11
title: love it
content: Well made and so Happy I purchased this for my Kindle. Don't have to hold it and can stand on Table while receiving my Infusions. Love It. Fast shipping and LOVE MY AMAZON BUY SO MANY THINGS THROUGH THEM.

The cover fits the exact same as my original Kindle but this time it constantly turns my Kindle on and off.  Very frustrating and ended up having to place an order for ANOTHER cover to even be able to use the Kindle with the cover on it.  Very disappointed.

author: Grammie Pammie

content: I wanted to replace my old cover, this was my second try and it doesn't have the turn off when closed feature, it's awkward and I really regret it.

author: Gayle

author: dsamora

content: No way to turn the Kindle off and on without taking it out of the case. Defeats the purpose. The case is nice and the feature that allows it to stand works well. Taking it out of the case each time I needed to power on or off is unacceptable.

author: Annette H. Anderson
title: Only origami
content: I had tried cheaper ones  at Walart and HSN....this was the only one that allowed access to the power button and mic

author: BK
title: Wish there were more color options
content:
Leather is good quality and standing feature case is great when viewing videos, etc.
I wish there were more colors available, however I've ordered in 'blue' and expect to be satisfied with it.  The imitation leather comes in bright colors like NEON and wish that had been an option.

author: grama4jr.
title: Love my Kindle
content:
Love to read....Love to play games...Love my Kindle Fire HD
Screen is clear, easy to read and no more trips to the library!
Wish I had purchased one a long time ago, so glad my daughter said Mom you will love it!  For once she was right !!  :)
Print is easy to make larger or smaller for older eyes like mine and the selection of books is endless and the price is well below what I expected.
Thanks Kindle, hope to enjoy for a long time!
Vickie Poe

author: Orlando Sixto
title: Perfect - without thinking about its weigth
content:
I guess the magnets inside it make it heavy. But it works perfectly and it is really a product that I would suggest everybody that buys the Kindle Fire HD 7 to have.

Another thing that I've just noticed, as the Kindle gets so perfectly fit inside it, absolutely no way it can fall off, you can use the case to put your Kindle, for example, in any vertical metallic surface, and the magnets are so strong, it will stay there.

author: aksteeel
title: Awesome Kindle case
content: My daughter loves this case, stand up feature is awesome.  Make sure you know which generation Kindle you have.

author: Wade Poulsen
title: Five Stars
content: nice

author: Cal Bonzelaar
title: The perfect fit!
content: I couldn't ask for a better fit & it looks great. The only negative is that I cannot push the on/off button from the outside of the case.

author: mary stembler
title: Kindle Origami Stand
content: Well made excellent cover and stand.  Totally happy with my purchase.  The case is a durable protection for the kindle and has a 3 ways  of standing.

author: elizabeth s riker
title: Five Stars

author: HeelShields

content: KIndle stops working when placed in the case.  Initially seemed like a great purchase.  Fancy and interesting.  However, the kindle went dead.  Took it out of the case and turned it on again - worked fine.  Put it back in the case - stopped working.  Sending it back

author: Lazar Mirman
title: Five Stars
content: Great

author: Nancy K. Croft
title: Works great!
content: It keeps my Kindle safe, and it helps me hold onto it. I can stand it up on my lap or on a table. I enjoy using it.

author: Julia
title: Nice!
content: I love it. It's nice & sleek & works exactly as advertised. It's well made & fits the Kindle just right. This is the case to get.

author: Jennifer
title: Not as Bright as the Pic
content: The case is good...I like the almost magnetic pull. However, the picture makes it look bright red and it's more of a burgundy/red color. Otherwise, good and functional.

author: Valerie Davis
title: Five Stars
content: Arrived in perfect condition and fits my Kindle Fire HD7 perfectly.

author: Dawn
title: Very nice!
content: Ordered this to go along with the Kindle Fire HD I ordered for my son as a gift.  It's very nice.  He likes it a lot.  Took it to a friend's house and got a lot of compliments on the very cool design :)

author: Matt
title: This is the best !
content: It's leather (plated ?) and fits my kindle fire perfectly. The magnetic cover works great as the origami stand that I don't use often. All the buttons work fine. No hassle charging. I love the leather feel while reading. It's perfect. I wish they had more leather grains\textures to choose from and maybe one that smelled like an old book....that would give it ten stars.

author: JeanneP357
title: Has a small problem.
content: I game this to my son with his new Kindle for Xmas and he was quick to point out the fact the Kindle was not even/level when it was set up in the case.  It is nicely made.

author: Kindle Customer
title: not the right case for the latest generation
content: This case does not work on the fourth generation (the openings do not match up with the buttons on the device).  This information  should be up front in the product description.  I was sorely disappointed when i tried to use this with my new kindle. For an older generation, this seems like a good case.

author: docpsifi
title: Caused problems when Kindle was installed
content: I was excited to tryout this case due to the ability to easily set it up to prop the Kindle up.  Unfortunately when the Kindle was placed inside of it, the Kindle instantly shutdown.  When I tried to turn the Kindle back on, it would not come on.  It would show only a black and white Kindle Fire logo on the screen and then shutdown.  If the Kindle was removed from the case, the Kindle would work fine.  Upon inspection, I realized what the problem was.  The area of the cover covering the power button is slightly depressed so when the Kindle is in the cover, the cover was constantly pressing down on the power button.  They need to redesign the case to prevent this from occurring.

author: Kindle Customer
title: I am glad I bought this
content: I am glad I bought this It protects and looks good and all the other stuff it does like I said I am glad I bought it

author: GotFaith
title: AWESOME!
content: This case is fantastic! It's sleek looking, smooth to the touch, and very cool how it props up horizontal or vertical... which makes it easy if I'm checking email or needing to prop it up while reading a recipe in the kitchen. VERY HAPPY with this purchase.

author: xrgtn
title: Currently this is the best case/cover I've ever seen
content:
Currently this is the best case/cover I've ever seen. It's what I wanted iPad's SmartCover to be, but Apple failed miserably with their botched attempt at tablet protection -- this one is really better. My Origami Case saw some abuse: dust, sand, a bit of rain -- and it's regularly carried in my bag being stuffed there together with steel items. So far it holds good and protects my Fire HD from certain death in such circumstances.
My only complaint here is about weight/bulkiness -- I'd like it to be slimmer and lighter, but I'm not sure this is possible without switching to titan/carbon and ditching leather, and I'd not consider non-leather case anyway.

author: N. Johnson
title: Amazing!!
content: If you want to protect (and I mean REALLY protect) your Kindle Fire, I highly recommend this case!! My son dropped his Kindle, with this case on it, in the snow in January. We were unable to find it...until April. It had been in -40 degree weather, snow piles, and moved by the snow plow for FOUR MONTHS!! We found it after the snow melted, in a puddle of water. After drying out and recharging, the Kindle worked!! The case was a bit dirty, but easily cleaned. I was absolutely amazed that this case prevented any damage whatsoever to his Kindle! This is a very happy Mom! Highly recommend!

author: rrh
title: Very nice case
content: This case is clearly designed for the kindle.  It is very stylish, and works well.  It does occasionally turn off the device because it is too easy to depress that button.  It does not protect the front edges of the Kindle in the event of a drop while the case is open.  This might be an issue for you depending on how and where you use it, and whom.

author: ROBERT BAUER
title: Waited way to long to get this and I love it.
content: I am using it mostly for books right now but plan on expanding it soon. Like the easy connection to Amazon and ability to order things with such ease.

author: JoAnn Shinn
title: Oragami case
content: I love being able to stand the kindle up while eating dinner, lol.  The case is easy to set up and is also attractive.

author: Judith
title: It was the best gift I have given to my 9 year old ...
content: It was the best gift I have given to my 9 year old granddaughter last Christmas....she loves it. Now her older sister wants a Kindle for Christmas.

True you shouldn't HAVE to do this, but I love the design and hate returning things.  Exercising this button helps a lot;  yet when I pick up the unit from time to time, it would still reboot.  Use a pair of pliers and remove that button (from inside the case), and problem fixed.  ALSO.. you can buy this case by other sellers for $14.99 rather than $49.99 (Amazon's price), and they sell them right here on Amazon too.  Choose another buying option for the cheaper price and get the EXACT same case.

author: kitcat
title: Not happy with this purchase
content:
I hate to do a bad review on this product as I really do like the design, but after 3 days of use I had to ask for a return because there were major issues with it.
Pros - I do like how thin the cover is – it almost feels as though there is nothing covering the Kindle, but the Kindle feels protected at the same time. It does fold so you can view by portrait or landscape. My Kindle did fit well and was very secure inside the case. I had no problems with charging while it was in the case.
Cons – The leather look isn’t exactly how I thought it would be. It almost feels like plastic – I would have done just as well with the cheaper plastic case I think. It was starting to grow on me, but the feel of it just never was right. The origami feature part of it that stands it up seems awfully flimsy to me. I never really got a chance to use that much, so maybe it would have worked fine, but I worry how long in the future it would have lasted. It does go to sleep by itself and back on when you close and open the cover, but only if I was away for a very, very short time. Any longer than that and the device would power itself off and I would have to hit the power button again, and that’s where the major problems started for me. I was not able to turn the Kindle on with the case on. It acts like the case doesn’t quite hit snug enough with the power button – I would have to barely tilt the Kindle out of the cover or take it out altogether in order to turn it on, even though the button looked like it was depressed properly. So basically every time I used it, I had to take it out of the case to turn it on. And the case fits very tightly, so you couldn’t just slip it out easily – it had to be pried out. I had issues with the Kindle trying to power itself off repeatedly while in use…sometimes while holding it (maybe my hand was over the power button – not sure), but other times while it was just sitting on a table downloading. I have had no issues with the Kindle when it’s not in the case with this, and have since bought another type of case and still no issue with this. This is the one thing that finally aggravated me to the point I had to return the product and find a replacement.
Hopefully Amazon will look at the reviews and make changes to this case as I think it is a really good design and could work very well.

content: Having had a first generation Fire I was thinking I was purchasing the  same quality I purchesed before.  I did not.  If you squeeze  the  case even gently it shuts your kindle off.  Not just once but mulitible times.  I thought it was me but it turns out this product is known for doing exactly what it is doing to me.  I wish I read the review before purchasing and save me the hassel of sending it back and hoping I get a refund.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Nice
content: The only problem is that it didn't fit my kindle. I couldn't figure out how to talk to a agent about it so I just kept it. No problem with it though. Nice quality

author: B. Stack
title: I like this case
content: It took me a while to get used to it.  I consider that time to be operator defect not the cover itself.  Essentially it folds one way.  It stays folded and it will support propping on short or long side.  The magnetic closer it just right.  The protection is good and I find it durable as it goes in and out of bag repeatedly during the day.  Long story short a good solid case for my kindle.

author: CarrieL
title: Five Stars
content: Good quality hopefully will hold up with time.

author: Amazon Customer just me , jack.
title: Fantastic Protection and Use
content: this is a Godsend product. if my grandson keeps using it like he has for the last two weeks and it makes him more aware of the need/use, then i spent my money well to purchase this item.

author: Kindle Customer
title: I don't like it. I like the one I got last ...
content: I don't like it. I like the one I got last year when we purchased my Kendall. Would like to have one like it again.

author: Carolyn Carroll
title: Origami Leather Case
content: I love that its leather and I like the fact that it comes on when you open the cover, you don't push any buttons, I also like it hands-free. Great Case.

author: T. M.
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent

author: Unknown
title: construction issue
content: I love the way it stands to hold my kindle while I read or watch something, but unfortunately the openings for the earphones and the recharger are not lined up right, nor do the buttons for volume and on/off fit right. All of these lead to me having to remove my kindle to use.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Doesn't fit what it says
content: I purchased this case along with the Kindle Fire HD 7.  Despite saying this case is only for kindle fire HD 7 it does not fit.  It is a really expensive case.  It doesn't fit at all!  The spots for buttons, camera, power are all in different spots.  I tried to return and they are only willing to give me 80% back on the product even though it was brand new.  Buyer beware.

author: ricia1
title: Very durable and flexible
content: This is a good durable case that is very flexible. My daughter has it on her Kindle and it has never cracked or broken since she has had it even when dropped. Very strong case and the origami design makes it easy to stand up.

author: Paulina Grijalva
title: Pretty but not practical
content: I loved it when I received it, and how it fit my new kindle, but my kindle kept turning off without any prompting, I was ready to complain about my kindle and getting ready to return it, then it occurred to try it without the case.  My kindle is now working fine, does not turn off without warning now. I wish the case wouldn't have that flaw, otherwise I would give it 5 stars

author: Kevin L. Sears
title: DON'T BUY THIS!!!!!!!
content: I'll start buy saying that this case looks awesome. But you'll quickly find out when you snap your kindle into, that it won't turn on. The power button on the case actually keeps the power button on the kindle depressed causing it to stay off. Again don't buy this. I've returned two of them and finally moved onto another case.

author: Casey G. Murray
title: Perfection
content: I was a bit hesitant about ordering this after reading a majority of the reviews, but I'm glad I went with my gut instinct and went ahead and ordered this anyway! I couldn't be more happier with this product! It does what it says and really protects your Kindle Fire HD. It does have a slight plastic feeling to it but it is leather material through and through. A lot of reviews states that the Kindle Fire HD powers down randomly and resets on its own without anyone ever touching the power button. Rest assured that this has NOT happened to me. I'm glad I didn't let those reviews influence me. If you're thinking about ordering this, do so with confidence that you will be receiving a quality product and will not be disappointed!

author: Romy Pescante
title: Two Stars
content: Did not much my kindle fire that I returned it.

author: Don Davis
title: Not Up to Standards set by Amazon Kindlle Fire 8.9 Leather Case
content: Opened this package and immediately sent it back.  Just too flimsy and awkward.  I just cannot get a case for my new Kindle Fire 7 that matches the quality and strength of the Amazon Kindle 8.9 Leather case.  I don't want something that folds and collapses.

author: John Haskin
title: This thing works great!
content: A very tough case for traveling and day in day out rough handling. Fits the Kindle perfect. Make sure you get the right size. I bought the 8.9" by mistake and had to send it back. There seems to be a lot of Kindel's with simular names. Double check before you push the order button. The Origami fold up thing works great. Well designed.

author: Mary928
title: It will not stand
content: The case fits nicely on my kindle,  the problem is getting the magnets to hold so the kindle will stay standing.

author: Shannon
title: great product!
content: This case has been a life-saver!  We got this for our son 13 months ago, and it has held up very well.  It is great protection when the Kindle has accidentally been dropped, and it stands easily and is sturdy when in use.  I was hesitant at first, because it was rather expensive,  but it has been money well spent!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Five Stars
content: just what I was looking for.

author: Scott R Farnum
title: Great Color - Works as expected!
content: The leather case feels great and I really enjoy the deep blue color.  The product fits the value & cost.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Excelletn
content: The perfect case!  Is covers the whole kindle so if I spill something it won't get wet.  The stand works great on my bed, when I am being lazy and don't want to watch something or read sitting up.  It goes off and on when you open and close the top.  Took me a while to find one that was completely covered.  Just notches where you plug things into and to work the volume.

author: kamal Al-Alawi
title: KINDLE FIRE HD
content:
The Good : Its Clear, easy to use, good support from Amazon, dose every thing well, books, games, calendar, time..ect.
The Bad: Cover connection is not straight due to the cover tight fit, screen reflection requires a matt screen protection cover (extra) and it takes a while to charge the battery.
The ugly: None.

author: Howard Greene
title: Needs a redesign
content: Great as a stand, but the holes don't seem to work with my kindle 7" tablet.

author: Celestia
title: Great improvement over the original.
content: This is a cover for my second Kindle Fire.  This one is so much easier to use than the first one because of its ability to sit upright and not have to hold it to support it.  It makes for easier viewing while sitting up in bed, sitting at a desk or reclining.

author: Jennifer Wheeler
title: LOVE
content: I love this case! It is a wonderful red color and works great! Would recommend this product to anyone. GREAT!

author: Kathy Fitzgerald
title: standing leather case for Kindle Fire
content: I love this stand, especially when watching movie...also when playing some of the games or reading.  I would recommend to all purchasing the Kindle Fire as it is an excellant protection for the device.

author: ms sunshine
title: Good case.
content: Ive had this case for as long as I've had my kindle, its very good and convenient since it has a stand. Will not protect your kindle if you drop it tho ..

author: Susan1
title: Returned this
content: Definitely would not recommend this. It offers little protection as a carrying case. And the stand is hard to use

author: Norene De Laurentis
title: Kindle cover.
content: It's ok, but I found it to be a little flimsy. But the quality is good,  and does serve the purpose.

author: Barbara Williams
title: Excellent Case
content: I love the Standing Origami Case.  It is a great protector and I am enjoying the hands free option of the case.

author: Kindle Customer
title: I really like the fact that it's magnetic and closes securely and ...
content: I really like the fact that it's magnetic and closes securely and that I can stand it up to be able to read easily.  The only drawback is the placement of the on/off switch seems a little inconvenient.

author: Kimberly
title: Cool case and stand!
content: The case is sturdy and cute, but the color is off...it's closer to brick or brownish red as opposed to RED! Otherwise the origami stand is really cool.

author: boomerang63
title: Good cover
content: Works great

author: chfjr
title: Excellent wrap for the Fire
content: This particular case is practical and sturdy, even with the origami based fold back.  As value propositions go -- this is a keeper.

author: Stefanie Knox
title: Love it
content: The Kindle is so easy to use. Still learning all the little tricks on what it will do which is fun. I like that I can order stuff quickly and pay with a touch of a button. I love to read, so ordering books and magazines on the spot really helps with my life style. thanks for the great product!

author: Kara
title: nice case for kindle hd
content: Nice case..easy to keep track of whose kindle is whose thx to color options.  Kids love that it can sit up and fold in dif ways for reading and watching movies.  Kind of pricey I thought but then I looked around and its comparable in cost to others so I went w this one.  Good decision I think in the end and will last a long time.

author: william p wahab
title: Disappointed.
content: did not turn the table on or off by opening case.  Disappointed.

author: Catherine Luther
title: Doesn't allow Kindle to work
content: This case is nifty in appearance, but the Kindle won't work when installed. The device powers down immediately upon being seated in the case and will not power up. It will power up, however, when removed from the case. I purchased a different case and the problem did not recur.

author: D. L.
title: would be nicer if it fit better
content: nicely made overall, but the case just doesn't fit. there's about 1/8" between the edge of the case and the tablet. the tablet's controls need to be accessed while it's in the case, and that's not an issue with the volume control side, but, the side with the power button doesn't ever match up to where it needs to be on the case, so you always have to pry it out to put it to sleep or turn it off.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Already broken
content: Although it was beautiful when it arrived, it already broke on the unions, almost new.  I had to buy another one locally because I could not use this one that much.  I will not recommend this item.

author: Dale A Craighton
title: If you're looking for something that feels really good and work for a good product already recommend
content: It comes open really nice it locks my tablet up really good I work in a factory it holds up my lunch bag fantastic I like it when I can set it up watch some videos if I have some Wi-Fi available or if I just have some music I like to play it really is a wonderful wonderful thing to have when you're on your device

author: TORF
title: Wrong product
content: What I really wanted was a cover for my Kindle fire, similar to the Marware cover I have on my Kindle Touch.  This isn't quite what I expected or wanted.  And, in my ignorance, I didn't realize that my new Kindle Fire HD was not an "All New Kindle Fire" so it didn't fit my Kindle, anyway.

author: Jerry
title: Kindle Case
content:
The case is very good in the way it fits and protects my Kindle Fire . It is also handy in how it turns my  Kindle on and off !
Thanks
  Jerry

author: Angelica Zamarripa
title: Five Stars
content: Sturdy n received on time

author: W Chuck
title: Keeps turning Kindle off!
content: I stopped using it because the case kept pressing the off button on the Kindle. The button on the case is too think.

author: Kevin Wilson
title: Five Stars
content: Just as described, fast service.

author: Denise P. Mortati
title: Not for the new Kindle Fire
content: This does not fit the new Kindle at all. Also, the magnetic close demagnetizes credit cards

author: Rose J
title: BUY IT!
content: This cover is the best!  I tried ordering a generic brand but it didn't do the trick.  This case is light weight, fits perfect, and I love the auto wake/sleep feature.  I ordered used "like new" and it looks new and it saved me over $10.  I haven't really needed the origami fold of it as I usually hold it as I read. Highly recommended for your kindle.

author: tevin
title: Strong and Dependable
content: Keeps my device nice and safe from being scratched/breaking from the abuse I'm able to put technology through. lol

author: Gigi111
title: Good cover...
content: I like this cover for my Kindle Fire HD.  I like the way it can sit length wise or width wise.  Keeps my Kindle Fire clean and the magnet holds my stylus in place when not in use.  It costs a little more than generic covers but I think it's worth it.

author: CHEYRL
title: HD Standing Leather Origami Case
content:
I received this as a gift and am really glad that I did not spend my money on it.
Quality of this item is just plain awful.  Put your money into an Otter box and be
done with it once and for all.

author: Lois E. Scales
title: Dissapointed
content: I really don't care for my leather origami case. it is too "floppy" when opening & closing it. My daughter bought a different kind for her Kindle Fire & I like it much better ( it was cheaper too).

author: Bruce Edenfield
title: Disappointed
content: Disappointed in product. The on off and volume buttons don't line up with the Kindle, so every time I want to make adjustments, I have to take it out of the case.

author: T-Mike
title: Love it!
content: Fit's perfectly and is solid.  Great case for the Kindle Fire.  Closes magnetically with no latches or straps to break.

author: PHATV
title: This did not work properly and kept powering the unit off as others have mentioned.
content: That said, another huge win for amazon. The few times, and they have been VERY few, that I have ever had to contact them about a bad or broken item, it was immediately resolved. Same thing in this instance.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awful
content: Why would anyone design and manufacture a case that turns the tablet OFF constantly?  This is what the magnet in the case does to the Kindle Fire.  This is the worst product design I have encountered.  It renders the tablet unusable.  I have no idea how Amazon continues to sell this disaster of a product.

author: Carol Berry
title: Great Kindle case
content: I love the origami Kindle case. It can be folded so that the Kindle will stand upright or sideways and it slants just right to sit on the bedside table and read hands free in bed. Love it!

author: Amazon Customer
title: I absolutely love my kindle
content: I absolutely love my kindle. Even more now that I have this case. I can stand it vertical or horizontal with ease. The magnets are hidden, beautiful sleek design that hugs and protects your kindle. Only regret is there aren't more stars I can give it.

author: Mike Marshall
title: Best Kindle Cover!
content: Nicely designed, well made, good quality for price.

author: Maria C.,Kindle Customer
title: Looks great and folds very conveniently
content: Looks great and folds very conveniently.  It just does not work.  The cover effects the power button and I cannot keep the kndle on.  Every time I shift it in my hand, it turns off.  I can hear go off and on while it is in my purse.  Very aggravating!  I will return it and find another cover.

author: Horsebytes
title: Designed for the Kindle Fire and Perfect for it!
content: I love this case!  I got mine at Best Buy but it has kept my Kindle Fire safe from harm.  The best part of this case is the magnetic closure that turns off the Kindle when the cover is closed and turns on the Kindle when the cover is opened.  Easy!

author: JacquieT
title: Great
content: The cover for my new Kindle is great.  I can set it on a table and watch what I want.  It protects the Kindle very good.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Amazing!! Must buy!
content: I love this stand!! It's amazing and a must buy! It not only protects your Kindle but it has a amazing stand which helps when it's late at night and I'm getting lazy holding m kindle! The price is a little expensive but I don't regret buying it!

author: Luigi
title: It Doesn't Work Properly
content: The Kindle had to be taken out of the case in order for the on/off button to work. When in the portrait position, it was at an angle. Finally, it didn't close tightly.

author: KDonatello
title: poor fit for kindle fire HD (we purchased it with the All new Kindle Fire HD)...it should have worked.
content: When the cover was placed on the Kindle, it would not turn on or off.  If the Kindle was on and we tried to put the case on it, it forced the Kindle to turn off.  It seems that the case did not align well with the Kindle itself.  Poor quality for the price.

author: Kindle Customer
title: kindle fire case wrong
content: The case did not fit. We tried to get a hold of customer service, but no luck. We bought a kindle fire and case that fit perfectly prior. I tried to get my wife a case for her kindle, but it was a quarter inch too big, and the button holes for volume and on off don't line up. We'd like the correct case.

author: Audzilla
title: DOES NOT FIT AT ALL
content: This does not fit my Kindle at all. The case has a hole on one side for a headphone and a hole on the other for a power and charge. My kindle has all the jacks on one side of it. The volume buttons don't line up either. I will HAVE to return this. Major Fail! I'm so disappointed. I've double checked over and over that I bought the right one. How can this be so wrong?

author: Mastercard
title: too soft
content: Very soft leather.  Doesnt work as standing. I use it as a good quality cover for my Kindle. Very light and flexible.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love It
content: At first I thought I wasn't going to like, but once I started using it I think it is great. I love that it turns off and on by opening and closing the cover. You also have the option of powering it off, which keeps the Kindle charged longer when you are not using it. I also love that the front of the cover can be folded all the way to the back and stays in place magnetically. There isn't really any thing I don't like about this cover. I would highly recommend it.

author: dannaa
title: Love it!
content: This has a nice fit and will protect my Kindle against just about anything. I like the stand up feature. If I had to say anything bad, it would be that I would love a pocket built in where I could keep a couple of dollars or my ID or something. Then, the only thing I would need leaving the house would be my Kindle!

author: James
title: Bought a "Like New" Version from Amazon Warehouse Deals
content: I paid about 90% less than MSRP for this case. So, for less than the cost of a cheesy plastic case I got this nice REAL leather case. Took me a minute to figure out how to fold it to get it to stay put in landscape position, but once I got it it stays put. Magnets secure it open folded behind the case, closed and in both portrait and landscape positions. My 2013 Kindle Fire HD fits in very securely so no worries about it slipping out. The leather has a nice feel, not too soft but better than the plastic version. The power and volume buttons work perfectly. The charge port is easy to access, unlike some cheap cases. The opening around the headphone jack is a little small, but most headphone plugs should fit.

author: T. Kester
title: After receipt of the 2nd one
content: I am again disappointed after receiving this cover that is supposed to be designed to fit my Kindle HDX.  This cover when installed has almost a 1/4" gap at one end and will not align with the holes for the volume and Off/On button.  You have to physically remove the Kindle from the case to turn it on and off.  I am really disappointed in this item and will shop out one that fits somewhere else.

author: NaturalMomma
title: Got this with my Kindle for Christmas first I wasnt sure about it..... however
content: However Im finding that I love that it stands the kindle up so I dont have to hold it all the time. Which means I can multi-task easier =) It is a great addiction to the Kindle. I dont have anything negative to say. I like that it protects the screen when not in use too!

author: D. Roberts
title: Works but not well
content: Not as good as the one I bought for my old Kindle. Doesn't recline enough and doesn't have enough different positions.

author: catherine smillie
title: cover
content: It is really heavy. I know I ordered the leather but if I had know it was this heavy I might have went with the cheaper one

author: Kindle Customer
title: Doesn't fit HDX
content: It''s not leather.  So it should not be advertised as such.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Bad Product - Don't Buy
content: Don't waste your money. After placing my Kindle in the case, it constantly wanted to turn off and the volume was doing the same. Whoever designed the case didn't test it. I ended up cutting the power and volume pads out so the dumb things wouldn't keep shutting my Kindle off/on. Pure dumbness. I'm kind of tired of returning things to Amazon, 70% of my purchases(not including) books have either broke or didn't work as advertised.

author: lovelyevenstar
title: Beautiful and functions well
content: Very sturdy. Beautiful and durable. Love the color and it stands well. Do not hesitate if you're thinking of getting this. It is absolutely worth the price.

author: gsquared
title: Not for a 3rd Gen 7" Kindle Fire HDX
content: While the 3rd generation 7" Kindle Fire HDX fits in the case, you cannot operate the sound or turn the Kindle on and off without removing it from the case. Thus I can use it to protect the Kindle if I'm travelling, but must remove it from the case to operate it.

author: B
title: Great!!
content: I ended up having to return this item because I ordered the wrong size. But from what I saw it is made with great quality.

author: Amy Zacharias
title: Nice case
content: Great case. Versatile, slim yet protective, bought for my son and he likes it. The color is kind of a maroon red.

author: Monopoly J
title: Did not fit the Kindle Fire HD 7" that I ...
content:
Did not fit the Kindle Fire HD 7" that I have. It says won't fit previous generation but I assumed that meant the first Kindle Fire. That could be made a little clearer. Other than that, I looked at the product and found it to be what I wanted had it fit.

Based on reviewing this item, I spent quite a bit of time finding one nearly identical that would fit the Kindle that I have.

author: Shirl Boyce Jr
title: Appears to be defective equipment
content: I liked its functionality, but it was suspected to be the cause for failure of my first Kindle  Fire HD. Returned both Origami cases for refund.  My Kindle just quit and would not work.  The technical help persona and I tried numerous things.  Finally asked if I an Origami case.  Was told stop using it and return Kindle HD for replacement.  It seems that those who use the Origami case have had similar experience.  Engineers can' f figure out why.  I suggest they look at effect of the strong magnets that hold it into position.  Perhaps Velcro would work better.

author: James Herndon
title: very bad design
content: case fits so tightly that it cuts off the Kindle.  Hard to turn on the device with the case "button"  Very cheap "leather" case. Flimsy and inefficient case stand structure.

author: unchained
title: good
content: I must say that I was always a kindle dude who did not focus on the fancy dancy side of the product.  bought this and to date I am impressed.

author: Karen
title: NICE CASE
content: a very nice case for the Kindle Fire.  My 7 year old has dropped it several times since receiving it and the case not only looks nice but has protected out kindle!

author: C. A. Macellaro
title: It's a Kindle!
content: Enough said! Topped my daughter's Christmas list. Exactly what she wanted and is now reading her first free book. I have a regular Kindle that I take everywhere and has been my buddy on vacations! Nothing like reading!

author: Janelle Mitzner
title: Great cover
content: It sure was great to find this cover when I couldn't find it anywhere else. Again, it exceeded my expectations.

author: C. Spencer Bailey
title: Five Stars
content: OK

author: Kindle Customer.
title: wouldn't want any other case.
content: It protects the Kindle and makes use easier.  I have bought one for each member of my family.  Like the colors for keeping them  individual.

author: Index David
title: Excellent case.
content: I was initially a little reluctant to spend as much as I did on this case, but, upon receiving and installing my Kindle in it, was glad that I did. Excellent quality and my Kindle Fire HD fit perfectly.

author: damgud
title: buy something else
content: i am SOOO disappointed in this case.  i have to pop it loose everytime i want to turn my kindle on or off; and the "sleeper" function...doesn't.  when i open it, the kindle does NOT turn on...when i close it, the kindle does NOT turn off.  i bought this on the recommendation of the amazon rep; he obviously doesn't own one.  my son has a roocase...that's what i'm going to get.  waste of $15...which is how much MORE i paid.

author: T. L. Weitze
title: It's okay.
content: Doesn't seem to work well when you want to stand your Kindle Fire like a Kindle (on the short end).  Works great on the long edge though, and protects my Kindle.  I also like that the magnets in the cover hold my stylus fairly secure.

author: Amazon Customer
title: this does NOT fit the Fire HD.
content: I read several reviews of this product before purchasing it. Over and over it stated it fit the Frire HD (not the HDX).  Well, surprise.. it does NOT fit the Fire HD.  Too bad because it was exactly what my Granddaughter wanted for Christmas, she opened it, then found out it didnt fit.. you can only return unopened packages!  I trusted the reviews and now I am sorry I did that

author: Paulie Sauce
title: One worked fine, the other kept pressing the power button.
content: I got two of these covers for the two Kindle Fires I bought my kids for Christmas.  (Returned those too, but that's a different story.)  The blue cover worked fine.  The red cover kept pressing the power button on the Kindle, so I'd be in the middle of using the device when it would suddenly ask me if I wanted to power off (no!) and then it would press the button again and turn the device off.  I never ended up giving the device to my 5 year old for Christmas as planned but I can only imagine how he would have reacted to the device turning off randomly.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Kindle Fire Origami case
content:
I like the way the cover top is magnetic and stays shut when closed.  I also really like the way it folds to stand up on its own.  It really is very easy to handle.

I would recommend this case to anyone who has a Kindle Fire HD 7". It protects it very well.

author: melissa bernt
title: kindle fire hd
content: i love the amazon kindle fire will order more in the future was a good price with free downloads easy to use shipping was fast ..

author: Thomas L
title: What is This
content: I bought the original kindle and got the hardback cover and I like it just fine.  I bought the 2nd generation for my wife for Christmas and I ordered the cover also......it is set to fold in many directions........don't know why........all it's good for is protecting the device. Be sure to read the description on how the new cover works....just remember it folds up like a piece of wet cardboard......which may be ok for how it's ultimately set up by the user.......but I don't like it  .I would rate 9 out of 10 for the first generation and 2 out of 10 for the second.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love it! I can use my kindle hands-free in ...
content:
Love it! I can use my kindle hands-free in both portrait and landscape positions, plus I never really use the power button because the kindle turns off when the cover is on and comes on as soon as I open it, saving me power and time.
My red leather version is uber stylish as well so its a win all round!

author: Bookem
title: Great
content:
I really like this simple concept. I have had no problems with it. Stands great.
If standing on the short side, it does seems to be offset a bit, but that could be my eyes playing tricks. Works great standing on long side.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Doesn't Fit
content: The description says will fit All New Kindle Fire HD but there is no way of determining which model you have. Got this as a gift, by the time it was unwrapped and tried it was too late to return it. Got this for my new HDX (other cover other Kindle) and love it.

author: Richard E.
title: Meets expectations.
content: While I am still getting used to it, I find it is a useful accessory for the Kindle Fire.  It makes using the Kindle much easier.

author: the B.A.T.
title: Super jealous!
content: My husband gave me a kindle fire in June 2013 with a beautiful Kindle branded leather cover in my favorite purple. My son, who like me, loves to read fell in love with the kindle. So for Christmas, we decided to purchase one for him. Having loved the kindle case, I knew we would be purchasing the kindle brand for him. In fall, the new kindle fire and kindle origami case was released. The origami is FANTASTIC. It is such an improvement over the previous kindle cover that I am jealous beyond measure. The previous case can slide and have my kindle land flat on the tabletop. I've learned to deal with it, but so wished the origami would fit my kindle. Of course it won't, because the new kindle fire is more square than mine. The origami case sits solid as a rock. I love, love , LOVE it! It is also handsome on the eyes.Good deal Amazon, can you retrofit the origami to the previous kindle fire, please, pretty, pretty please!

author: Plezmoo
title: Great fit
content: Great fit. Nice cover that is not too bulky.  Very useful as a stand and does protect Kindle.  Excellent product

author: dgsavage
title: Does not have a camera
content: My daughter asked me to purchase this for a Christmas present for my grandson.  We both insisted it had a camera.  He insisted it did not.  We cared.  He did not.  He loves it.  That makes me happy.

author: Sherilee Phillips
title: One Star
content: Can't turn it on or off without removing it from the case.

author: syl
title: I am happy with the product
content: Very well made and durable.  Sometimes its does not turn Kindle on or off as it's supposed to do.  Takes a little coaxing.  Otherwise, I am happy with the product.

author: WeezyB
title: Case was a bid disappointment!
content: Fits nicely, a nice idea for stand.  The problem is it doesn't fit well enough for the on/off button to work so I have to lift part of it out of the case to turn it off and on.  Either the button doesn't line up quite right or it does not move enough to get in contact with the Kindle  to work.  A big disappointment in that manner.  Would probably cost as much to return as I paid for it so haven't decided yet what to do. Promo says it's leather but feels much more like plastic.

author: M. E. Alexander
title: blue standing leather origami case
content: Bought it for my husband's new Kindle Fire HD.  Looks great, protects the screen well and is easy to fold into the stand up position.  Good purchase!

author: KateR
title: Does not stay upright
content: So the comercial is somewhat misleading. There is only one way to "fold" the oragami case, and I had difficulty getting the case to stay in an upright position. Overall, I was not impressed especially after paying over $40.

author: Mel B
title: Turns the kindle off every five seconds!
content: My son used his money he saved up to buy the Kindle Fire HD and this case. We got it and it kept turning off in the case! I should have read the reviews before I bought this. However, the power button part of the case can pop out. It makes it more difficult to turn off, but my son has little fingers. I did the same with the volume buttons at the top. It does do the thing where it "sleeps" when you close the cover, but after reading some of the reviews of the magnetism hurting the kindle I may get a new case.

author: Kindle Customer George Nottingham
title: I was really disappointed with it
content: I was really disappointed with it. It would be hard to use, while reaing in bed, for example. The opening for the on/off button and the charging port don't line up with the opening for it...My Kindle Fire HD does not fit well in the cover. I adapted my original leather cover to fit and I am in good shape at this time. When a leather cover is developed for it, like the old one, please tell me.  Thanks For asking.

author: Chris Carroll
title: Returning it the Same Day it Arrived
content:
I read reviews before I purchased this cover, and while I saw some negative ones, I also saw quite a few good ones. I should've paid more attention to the negatives. I got this case today, and almost as soon as I put it on, the Kindle powered down. I pushed the power button, but it just kept cycling through the first part of the power up sequence. I realize that there's a sort of "button" in the case that sits on top of the power button, but no matter how careful i was or how this external "button" was sitting, I had the same problem.

I've already started the return process, and will probably just go find a pouch for it or something, as I'm betting the official polyurethane cover will have the same problem. I'm just disappointed that Amazon would let such a crummy product be released.
